title: Watermelon

adjectives: That can be eaten without harm; innocuous to humans; suitable for consumption.
That can be eaten without harm, non-toxic to humans; suitable for consumption.
Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.
Having or showing good taste; tasteful.
Extremely pleasing to the sense of taste
verbs: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.
nouns: Any of numerous fruits of the gourd family having a hard rind and sweet juicy flesh

A fruit of any of the species from the family Cucurbitaceae that has relatively hard inedible shells and plenty of sweet flesh. The fruits may vary in size but is usually not smaller than one decimeter in diameter.
The ripened reproductive body of a seed plant
Fruit, in broad terms, is a structure of a plant that contains its seeds.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, often edible, colourful/colorful and fragrant, produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
A fully matured plant ovary with or without other floral or shoot parts united with it at maturity.
In botany, a fruit is a part of a flowering plant that derives from specific tissues of the flower, one or more ovaries, and in some cases accessory tissues.
The fruit of the watermelon plant (Citrullus vulgaris, Citrullus lanatus), having a green rind and watery flesh that is bright red when ripe and contains black pips.
The fruit of the watermelon plant, having a green rind and watery flesh that is bright red when ripe and contains black pips.
Watermelon is a vine-like flowering plant originally from southern Africa.
Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

description:
A slice of watermelon, showing its rich pink flesh, black seeds, and green rind.

Can be used to reference the flag of the Palestinian Territories.
apple_vendor_description: The watermelon emoji on Apple devices is a vibrant burst of summer, presented with a luscious, deep red interior and a perfectly rendered rind of variegated green. Apple's characteristic glossy 3D shading makes the juicy texture almost palpable, with subtle highlights suggesting its refreshing coolness. It‚Äôs a universally recognized symbol of summer fun, sweetness, and outdoor gatherings, bringing a taste of sunshine to any message.
